definition.text: The P2P Network Reference node defines which Peer to Peer network the current Network node will run within.

paragraphs.text: This node holds a reference to a P2P Network node allowing the User to control exactly which peer to peer network will be accessed.
There are three main types of peer to peer networks.
TestNets used for testing peer to peer functionality.
Permissioned networks that are only accessible with the right credentials.
Open networks that can be accessed freely.
